title: Why Varus might need a buff
body:
- No mobility

- Q has a 70 mana drain with a 16 second, to 14 second cooldown levels 1 and 2 - pretty high.

- Ult practically does no damage, has a smaller hitbox than Morgana's Q, shorter range,  and roots for a shorter duration than Morgana's Q when fully upgraded.

- Ult isn't even a true root, Wu Kong can still ult and move when hit with Varus' ult for example.

- His passive kicks in when a champion is dead. Instead a passive should be needed that helps get a first kill, rather than a 2nd. 

- Passive can basically be bought from the shop for 900 gold (Recurve Bow).

**Old**
***Living Vengeance***
On a minion or monster kill, Varus gains 20% attack speed for 3 seconds. On a champion kill or assist, Varus gains 40% attack speed for 6 seconds. These bonuses do not stack with themselves.
**New**
***Distribution*** (idk wat for the name)
When Varus damages an enemy champion with one of his skill shots (q,e,r), he gains 20% attack speed for 3 seconds. On a champion kill or assist, Varus gains 40% attack speed for 6 seconds. The will does not refresh or stack with each other. The kill or assist buff takes precedence over the landing the skill shots buff.

As a Varus main, I'd like to add my two cents. Varus is in an interesting spot balance-wise because he is pretty balanced, but he's also a jack-of-all-trades as a caster ADC hybrid. He can destroy the other team if he's having a good game but just as easily be the load if he falls behind at any point. I think what he needs is some quality of life buffs so that he can be even more fun to play as and still be fun to play against.

On the topic of mobility, I think Varus is good as an immobile ADC. It fits his identity and he has some nice cc to make up for it.

His Ult definitely needs a wider hitbox. It's infuriating when it looks like you hit your enemy but then it turns out you somehow missed. It would also be nice if the damage was higher, but I feel that his ult is used more for the cc.

His Q was supposed to be a more dominant part of his kit, and I feel like its a core part of his identity. It needs some tweaks to be more forgiving if you miss. I think it needs a lower cooldown. Someone here posted an idea that kills and assists should refresh the cooldown.

His passive lets him clear through waves quickly, which is great. I think it could use a couple tweaks to help fit in with his identity and help Varus out if he had a weak early game. This may be overpowered, but here's my idea:
>>Living Vengeance
On a minion or monster kill, Varus gains 20% attack speed for 3 seconds. On a champion kill or assist, Varus gains 40% attack speed for 6 seconds. These bonuses do not stack with themselves.
Every minute Varus gains 1 AD.

The concept is that Varus wastes no time killing things once he's gotten his target and that the corruption is making him more powerful as time goes on.

I don't think varus is completely out of the meta right now, though I don't think he is comparatively as strong as the other adc's that are in.  His E is a terrible escape tool as the cast time WILL get him caught any time he uses it.  Realistically it shoul be able to be fired while moving, much like jinx's chompers.  The abilities are pretty balanced, and you have to be careful when spamming abilities, which is fine.  I think his base AA should be slightly increased because doing anything with his base AA speed is ridiculous.

I feel like his Q is his biggest weakness:
- Long cooldown
- Extremely predictable
- High mana cost
- Even if you land a Q enemies will have had enough time to hide behind creeps, significantly reducing his damage.

I've always thought Varus is a pretty cool champion. I think his biggest problem right now is that he doesn't really have a niche. If you want a lane bully, there are much better options. If you want raw, late game carrying potential, there are much better options. If you want safety, there are much better options. And if you want utility on your ADC, there is a better option. People rag on Ashe a lot, and she does deserve a buff, but at least she has a clear niche--she's the utility marksmen. Regardless of what you're looking for, there is always a better option than Varus. 

If Riot is going to buff him, I think they should look at his Q. It's a really cool ability on paper, and it seems like it should be the defining aspect of his kit in lane, but it's just not good enough. Sure, it does a lot of damage when it lands, but it's heavily broadcasted, easy to dodge, and deals pretty low damage if it passes through a minion on the way to its target. 

I mean, hell, when he saw a brief spike in popularity back in S3, people weren't even leveling his Q first. As I recall, they were leveling his E (? could have been his W) first for burst during trades. 

Some buff to his Q (either its reliability, or its power when it does actually land on a champion first) would help give him the niche he needs.

It does no damage if you're built on AD, but then you're using the root so you can land more attacks/Blight stacks and deal more damage. If his ultimate had a high base, Varus would need nerfs elsewhere. And then, if you're building AP Varus, it's better than Morgana's Q for damage, more reliable because it has almost twice the travel speed, *and it's multi-target*
> - Ult isn't even a true root, Wu Kong can still ult and move when hit with Varus' ult for example.

There isn't a single CC in the game that stops Wukong's ultimate when he has already started, and no snare will keep him from casting it either.

I think some of you are missing the point. What makes Varus, well, Varus?

Is it his passive? No... Is it his W magic damage? While interesting, that's not why I'm picking Varus. What about his Hail of Arrows? Something I should be good with, but ultimately no.

Q and R is why you pick Varus. This is where the buffs should be! Q helps him clear waves quickly and safely, while poking pretty darn well. R is unique to an AD carry: the capability of hard CC on multiple units. IMO this means that Q needs a mana cost reduction and CDR reduction, while his R should have a larger hitbox and more range, albeit missile speed tapers off later.

Is his passive a tad clunky? Yes, but you don't play Kog'Maw for his passive now, do you? In other words, his passive could use work but I'd rather they buff the reason why people pick Varus instead of just a buff any ADC would be happy to have.

I don't know what you guys are talking about. 
Considering just yesterday i got a penta kill and a triple kill (which could have easily been a penta if the lucian didn't run at the start of the fight) in one game. 

Yes he has a few quarks which don't fit in perfectly with the meta, but as a champion he doesn't lack power. The only thing i would argue is that thanks to the addition of {{champion:201}} and {{champion:157}}, his projectiles are far to easy to read and block. 

Also i don't totally mind his passive only giving him post kill benefits. The reason is that in a well coordinated team, a single target should die fairly quickly, and if you are fighting in lane, not only does it make last hitting much easier, but it also means that if you are farming correctly then you should have an attack speed advantage if you or the enemy initiates.

I don't like the idea of moving his W to his passive, because that would most likely remove the scaling. I don't play it a lot, but AP varus is enjoyable if not practical. It's like AP poppy, except if you half health the whole enemy team with a few auto attacks and and E.
He is fine. He just needs a better fitting item. With the Old BT + LW build he would still have his perfect niche.

He's better mid as an AD caster, in fact, he really kills anyone. I just build Essence Reaver first for mana costs, than anything that gives me the highest damage possible. Late game he can duel alot of enemies, mostly ADC's and APC's in addition to tanks thanks to his blighted quiver. Bot lane it's harder to play him with supports like Braum who block his damage and Thresh who hooks him whenever Varus casts Q because he's too immobile to dodge it.

His E and ult can both be used to slow/lock-down escaping targets, and as ways to self-peel when you're being attacked. To fix his mana issues, just buy mana pots, or purchase and build up to this:{{item:3042}}, or better yet, get one of these:{{item:3508}}. The point of his ult is to *lock targets down* so you can auto attack/combo them to death, not to be some high-damage attack: that's what Q is for, besides you're an AD carry, all you need the ult for is locking your enemy down for a good sec so you can drop your Q + E + x amount of AAs on them, and with your passive in use after you kill a minion, it should be a breeze to snowball that passive in a teamfight. If you decide to buy more attack speed, it will stack with your passive once that kicks in from kills, decreasing your opponent's escape window, allowing you to eat through teams.
